item.title: avoid-hidden-arguments
item.description: Avoid hidden arguments – Tidyverse design guide https://twitter.com/mauro_lepore License: CCO Hidden arguments make code harder to reason about, because to correctly predict the output you also need to know some other state y <- 1 add <- function(x) { x + y } add(1) #> [1] 2 y <- 10 ## It is hard to keep track of this add(1) #> [1] 11 Functions are easier to understand if the results depend only on the values of the inputs How can I remediate the problem?
